channel.title: Why does my comp take so long to respond?
channel.description:
My computer takes so long to respond when its on I can't do anything there's just that circle there it takes about 30 minutes to respond.
It shouldn't be doing this I just got the computer on christmas.
Is there a way to speed up my computer?

item.title: Why does my comp take so long to respond?
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

n10si t:

lol windows

Read full topic
item.source: Why does my comp take so long to respond?

item.title: Why does my comp take so long to respond?
item.dc:creator: @P_A_N_I_C P A N I C
item.description:
@P_A_N_I_C wrote:

Try uninstalling some things on it (tool bars, things you dont use)

I did that too mine worked great.
Also how many connections are you using on your computer?

Read full topic
item.source: Why does my comp take so long to respond?

item.title: Why does my comp take so long to respond?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Install Linux.

Or, I suppose you could boot a LiveCD, check for any Hard Disk errors, cd into the directory and delete your porn stash.

If all else fails, you might be able to find a Windows Diagnostics CD somewhere.

Read full topic
item.source: Why does my comp take so long to respond?

item.title: Why does my comp take so long to respond?
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

[quote=“pk2play, post:1, topic:395591”]My computer takes so long to respond when its on I can’t do anything there’s just that circle there it takes about 30 minutes to respond.

It shouldn’t be doing this I just got the computer on christmas.

Is there a way to speed up my computer?[/quote]
You could have a windows 98 from a week ago, that doesn’t mean it will run fast.
Upgrade your ram if the other suggestions have failed.

Read full topic
item.source: Why does my comp take so long to respond?

item.title: Why does my comp take so long to respond?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

as mentioned, check for viruses, via virus scanner and task manager, as I have personally that easily slip under the radar. As well as, look up a program called ‘speed test pro’, My old computer benchmarked at under 600MHz, while the processor was a 1.6GHz.

Read full topic

item.title: Why does my comp take so long to respond?
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

Ctrl+Alt+Delete, check for any processes using up a lot of Memory or CPU. If none are shown, check Resource Manager for programs taking up your CPU. Otherwise, a new processor may be good.

Read full topic
